newsitem.title: USA: Viragen debunks reports CEO selling shares.
newsitem.headline: Viragen debunks reports CEO selling shares.

text.p: Viragen Inc said Wednesday it was debunking Internet and newswire service reports that a man named Michael Grosbest, who was supposedly its chief executive officer, had sold varying amounts of shares of the company.
The reports were "completely false," the biopharmaceutical company said in a statement.
Viragen chairman Gerald Smith said, "there is not, and never has been, a Michael Grosbest" in the company or its subsidiaries.
He said the reports, which purported to be based on regulatory filings, were "obviously calculated to mislead the investing public."
Smith said that the company has reported the matter to the National Association of Securities Dealers and appropriate authorities.
